item.description:
Campaign for Liberty 5th Congressional District Meetup - Middlebury, CT
(5th District is Danbury, Waterbury to Meriden, to Newington, New Britain, west of Hartford, and the Northwest corner of CT)

Come meet your fellow 5th district C4L members!

On 1/24/09 at 2 pm, we'll be at Maples Restaurant in Middlebury, CT. Maples is an inexpensive restaurant - come join us for a drink or a snack if you like. This location seems to be relatively fair for those who have said they would attend. We'll keep this informal, as it is our initial meeting.

Here are my thoughts on the "loose" agenda:

1) Meet and greet
2) Discuss 5th district and state-wide issues.
3) What can we do to gain exposure in our community?
4) How to go about recruiting Liberty-minded folks.
5) What tools do we need to grow in Connecticut? ideas?
6) Connecticut 2010 election cycle priorities (Chris Dodd is up for reelection, Chris Murphy, etc.).
7) The Connecticut focused pro-liberty website (under construction currently).
8) Misc. (other issues that come up).

To those not in the 5th District:

Feel free to attend this!

I'm talking to a few other C4L folks in CT about having a statewide meeting. I hope this could be in March or April. (Jim Azzola supports this).

The agenda for this statewide meeting would be more "set in stone," and I would like to arrange some speakers, etc...

If you'd like to work with us to plan this, please contact me ASAP.

Andrew Sica
item.name: Campaign for Liberty 5th Congressional District Meetup - Middlebury, CT
